Different Crime.Crime Name: Being a member of an organization that there are reasonable grounds to believe engages, has engaged or will engage in terrorism
evidence_provided: no evidence supported civil wing distinction

Different Crime.Crime Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act subsection 34(1)(f)
legal_basis: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act subsection 34(1)(f)
decision_reasoning: Membership in Amal, a group involved in terrorism
No evidence supporting division between civil and terrorist wings of Amal
Long membership and awareness of Amal's activities
application_details: Judicial review application before the Federal Court challenging the IRB's decision
result_of_case: Federal Court dismissed the application, upholding the IRB's decision
relevant_rule: Subsection 34(1)(f) deems individuals inadmissible if they are members of organizations engaging in terrorism
